question: The circuit shown in figure contains two ideal diodes $D_1$ and $D_2$. If a cell of emf 3V and negligible internal resistance is connected as shown, then the current through $70\Omega$ resistance, (in ampere) is
images/e3f4a5b6-c7d8-4e9f-0a1b-2c3d4e5f6a7b.png
explanation: Diode $D_1$ is reverse biased (cathode to positive), so no current flows in the top branch.
Diode $D_2$ is forward biased (anode to positive), so current flows.
